I curate Songpickr playlists on various music streaming services, run the Songpickr Facebook page, tweet about music and concerts, share pictures on Instagram and run the Songpickr website. My motivation is to find new music and artists because there is so much good music and talent out there which is often filtered out by traditional media. Just as download pre-sales are tallied as first-day sales (improving your chances of charting), the more people that pre-save your release on Spotify, the more impressive your first-day streaming activity will be.”

Put yourself in their shoes, and figure out why they should care about this particular e-mail from an artist they don’t know, especially when they have an inbox chock-full of similar e-mails.
It’s clear what the benefit is for you, but what’s the benefit for them?

Communicate your authenticity and that you’ve actually taken the time to listen to their playlist. Keep your message fairly brief, but be specific about what you’re asking, and make it as easy as possible for them to say ‘yes.’”

These days people just want as much content as possible. So, the release plan should be SINGLES.
Releasing singles as often as possible throughout a longer timeline means that you can engage fans with EVERY release.
For example, if you had a 12 track album, you could release those tracks every other month as singles. And by doing it this way, you would be taking advantage of the Spotify algorithm.
If you release an album, Spotify only selects 1 track. If you release the 12 songs as singles, each track has a chance of being picked up by the Spotify algorithm.”
